dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4301 IH: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 201 Tom Hall Street in Fort Mill, South Carolina, as the “J. Elliott Williams Post Office Building”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Norman (for himself, Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Mr. Duncan of South Carolina, Mr. Sanford, Mr. Rice of South Carolina, Mr. Clyburn, and Mr. Gowdy) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 201 Tom Hall Street in Fort Mill, South Carolina, as the J. Elliott Williams Post Office Building.

section.header: J. Elliott Williams Post Office Building

subsection.text: The facility of the United States Postal Service located at 201 Tom Hall Street in Fort Mill, South Carolina, shall be known and designated as the J. Elliott Williams Post Office Building.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the J. Elliott Williams Post Office Building.
